Context:
The George Brown College's Academic Upgrading Program for Deaf and Hard-of-Hearing Adults (A752) is a tuition-free program designed for Deaf and hard-of-hearing students to upgrade their English, ASL, and math skills for further education and employment. The program is funded by Employment Ontario through the Ministry of Labour, Training and Skills Development (MLTSD).

The program offers courses taught in American Sign Language (ASL) at various levels for Math and ASL. The Math courses include Academic and Career Entrance (ACE) Workplace Math, ACE Business Math, ACE Apprenticeship Math, ACE Technology Math, and Financial Literacy. The ASL courses offered are American Sign Language – ASL 1 and Academic ASL.

Students can choose to take some courses in-person or online, subject to availability. Registered students who are regularly attending the program may be eligible to receive a transportation subsidy, a netbook, and/or monthly Internet device. The program has intakes in January and September, and acceptance is based on an ASL and English assessment and interview.

Required courses for the program vary depending on students' goals and their current level of study. Examples of required courses include ENGL 7071 (Pre-Foundations Communications), ENGL 7073 (Foundations Communications), ENGL 7075 (Pre-Ace Communications), MATH 7068 (ACE Workplace Mathematics), MATH 7070 (Pre-Ace Mathematics), MATH 7072 (Financial Literacy), MATH 7136 (ACE Mathematics for Business), MATH 7137 (ACE Mathematics for Apprenticeship), and MATH 7138 (ACE Math for Technology). An additional course, PREP 7139 (Learning Strategies), is also required.

The program is funded by Employment Ontario through the Ministry of Labour, Training and Skills Development (MLTSD).

Context:
Programs Offered: ASL 7001 (Academic ASL), PREP 7139 (Learning Strategies), PREP 7142 (Career and Life Planning)
Program Learning Outcomes: Deliver specific knowledge and skills for students by the end of their program of study.
Domestic Tuition: Free, funded by Employment Ontario through the Ministry of Labour, Training and Skills Development (MLTSD)
Admission Requirements: Completion of application form, demonstrating proficiency in American Sign Language (ASL) and English, intended for Deaf and hard-of-hearing adults aged 19 or older.
Application: Complete the application form.
Contact Information: Email - deafupgrading@georgebrown.ca, located within the School of Work and College Preparation at 341 King Street East on the 6th floor (St. James Campus, “H” building), Toronto, Ontario.
Related Programs: American Sign Language and Deaf Studies (C114), Academic Upgrading (A751), Honours Bachelor of Interpretation (American Sign Language – English) (C302)
Campus Tour and Resources: Visit campus tour page and sign up to receive tailored resources for application process.
